newsitem.title: AUSTRIA: Die Erste 9-mo oper profit up 14.2 pct.
newsitem.headline: Die Erste 9-mo oper profit up 14.2 pct.

text.p: Die Erste, Austria's largest savings bank, said on Monday operating profit in the first nine months of the year rose to 1.371 billion schillings, from 1.201 billion a year ago.
The bank said the 14.2 percent increase came despite "difficult conditions in the banking sector".
Die Erste added interest margins remained under pressure, while the bank's risk profile was largely unchanged. Austrian banks report operating profit before risk provisions.
Operating income rose 3.1 percent, boosted by a 27.9 percent increase in commission income to 1.251 billion schillings. Net interest income fell 5.3 percent to 3.028 billion, the bank said.
Operating costs were down 0.7 percent at 3.540 billion schillings as staff costs fell 2.1 percent to 2.294 billion.

Total assets of Die Erste, which is a member of an Austro-Italian-German group bidding for privatisation candidate Creditanstalt, rose to 234.4 billion schillings from 217.7 billion a year ago, the bank said. -- Vienna newsroom +431 53112 274
